alert.note: Alert for Harding (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 6:51PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harding County through 745 PM MDT... At 650 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles east of Ekalaka to 7 miles northwest of Camp Crook to 5 miles southwest of Gustave. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Camp Crook around 655 PM MDT. Harding around 710 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include East Short Pines, Ladner, Redig, South Cave Hills, Ludlow and North Cave Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight MDT for northwestern South Dakota.
